comment.body:
Being a developer myself, I find this discussion very interesting, specially because what most Ethereum/Bitcoin/Blockchain-in-general evangelists **don't** talk about.

Smart contracts: we can trust the engine in which they run, but can we trust the developers? And so the answer can act against the whole point of the blockchain thing: once something is done there is no way back.
If a bogus smart contract send lots of ethers to a wrong "account", how can we undo this mistake? We can't?

Hummmmm... lots of things to work out in this new world of no central authorities...
Too young, much money, at home every day. These are not signs of a drug dealer anymore...
"Finding The Greedy, Prodigal, and Suicidal Contracts at Scale". Nice title.
